website_summaries.verdict: Solid noise cancellation, powerful audio performance, and a water-resistant build make the Sony WF-SP800N a strong contender in this price range
pros: Powerful audio performance with deep bass and sculpted highs
App has ANC and EQ controls
Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant support
cons: Large charging case offers less extra battery life than usual

customer_reviews.title: My one cent.
customer_reviews.text: Both earbuds cannot connect to Bluetooth individually. You can only connect with the left ear. So if you are going to be using the left ear sometimes, the battery will wear out faster than the right ear. It will be nice if they can both be connected individually so you can use any ear if you want. But using them together, they are good.
customer_reviews.author: JJ.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to wear, clicking noise when walking
customer_reviews.text: Had my Airpods since launch in 2016 and love them, super comfortable, great sound and never, ever fall out. Eventually though battery life is diminished after 4 years down to 1 hour. I had a look at alternatives and these came highly rated. Have to say super disappointed. Very uncomfortable to wear and although sound good sitting still I get a mechanical clicking noise I guess from seal opening and closing every step when walking. I would say the sound is good but no better than Airpods. Thank goodness Amazon have such an excellent customer service and returns policy.
customer_reviews.author: DrMagical

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound Quality & Clear Base, But Almost Non Existent Noise Cancelling
customer_reviews.text: The Sony WF-SP800N ear buds fit well into the ear, with all the range of provided accessories, although fitting both the Silicone Rubber Earbuds, and especially the Arc Supporters to the WF-SP800N was exceptionally difficult and very fiddly. The ear buds reproduce sound very well, especially the clear base notes! The Noise Cancelling function of the Sony WF-SP800N is very poor and almost non existent, even in a quiet area with only a few distant voices?? The Sony Headphone App, is a bit clunky, and not too intuitive to use!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. N. C. Lauder

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest! But if they fit you well, go for it.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: +Sound Quality is good when you use neutral eq from the app. Clear and Punchy. +Auto On-Off feature is handy. +NC is there, but not so great. +Sweat resistant. +Some good features through Sony app. Cons: -Fit for my ears was particularly poor, they kept falling out during gym session, that was the deal-breaker for me. -Touch controls are easy to activate accidently.
customer_reviews.author: leonid_82

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box they were incredibly simple to setup. I had a bit of trial and error with getting the right combination of wing and earbud sizes as they would be fine whilst walking but would feel loose whilst running so I was adjusting constantly. After finding the right combination this is no longer an issue and I have a perfect fit now. The battery life is great and they charge quickly too. I went out for a run in the stormy British weather a few weeks back and they held up to the claim of being waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.text: Good fit, sound ok not as much as Sony claims.. respond to ur taps poor .. charging case very cheep made .. overall not worth the money u spend.. still l love my AirPods over and is winning in all top brands. Don’t waste ur money on this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nariany

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Having owned the premium models and been forced to return them as them simply did not stay in my ears, the sp800n are fantastic. Brilliant fit in the my ears (and please let me stress the word 'my', earphones sadly are not one size fits all). Very pleased with the sound quality and noise cancellation ability.
customer_reviews.author: Conor Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth connectivity can be a bit dodgy at times as well as the inter connect between the two buds. Other than that, sound is great, battery life is great and the charging case is very nifty.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Viani-Pericchi

customer_reviews.title: I so wanted them to be great!
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones but the controls are so hit and miss I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: David Powers

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice love it Good bass Good treble Loud but not really loud Functional Stylish
customer_reviews.author: star man

customer_reviews.title: Not for calling
customer_reviews.text: One star, as these are useless for making or receiving call unless it’s deadly silent! Disappointing really as the music sound is really good!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Sorry but returned to Amazon for a refund
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with these. I bought them for use in the gym. I found the sound quality very ordinary no matter how much I adjusted the Sony App settings. During set-up they have a 360 degree sound function which while playing a comparison music sample improved the sound quality greatly however that's only available with Deezer (and 2 or 3 other streaming apps) but not Spotify which I use. Noise cancelling - I could still hear noise from other gym equipment especially air resistance bikes. Quality - as you'd expect from Sony a beautifully made product shame about the performance. The sound from my standard cabled iphone earphones is better!
customer_reviews.author: Faulty Tool

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless earbuds that stay in!
customer_reviews.text: I have the more expensive WF-1000XM3 which are great but not so great when working out in the gym. Spotted the WF-SP800N and thought I'd give them a try. Not had them that long but have done 2.5 hour workouts without a bud dropping out. This is the first bud of any kind that has stayed the course. Am not a music buff so they may not be the best but using them for music and talking books they are perfect for me. They are not cheap but am VERY happy with my spend on this occasion.
customer_reviews.author: ColinH

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could say they’re perfect but due to an incompatibility of design and my ears had to return them. The sound was good but not the best as I was expecting from the sport version of the famous MX3. Try them before buying if you can
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Sony Again
customer_reviews.text: A VERY POWERFUL EARBUDS WITH EVERYTHING THAT WAS DISCRIBED FROM THE PROFESSIONAL REVIEWERS,NOT THE TOP DOG BUT VERY CLOSE. WORTHY OF EVERY PENNY.
customer_reviews.author: maxwell creese

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancelling doesn't really block out sound and they are pretty quiet but they do sound good and battery life is good as well
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: A much improved version offered from Sony, with an upgrade on waterproofing. Noise cancelling is as good as always from Sony. It really is right up there with some of the best. I have some B&O headphones and this is on par. Such a great quality set of headphones for the £150-£200 price bracket. And they stay on your ears, which is a lot more that can be said for their predecessors. These are some solid headphones, wonderful bass with minimal distortion at the high volumes. Excellent mid levels too. You could spend much more and get a lot less than what these WF-SP800N have to offer.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Rouse

product_meta.title: Sony WF-SP800N Noise Cancelling Truly Wireless Headphones – Stable Bluetooth Connection – Up to 26 Hrs Battery – Ip55 Water/Dust Resistant – Secure Fit with Arc Support – with Built-in Mic - Black
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:BlackFocus on nothing but your goals with the WF-SP800N truly wireless noise cancelling sports headphones. Featuring IP55* water and sweat resistance, they also offer long battery life, stable Bluetooth connectivity, and EXTRA BASS for deep, punchy sound.

*Protection assured against water jets projected by a nozzle (6.3mm) from any angle, excluding the sound tube (sound outlet) of the headphones. Protected against quantity of dust that could interfere with the normal operation of the product but not fully dust tight. Complete protection against solid objects."
feature_bullets: 9 hours battery life/18 hours total battery life with charging case, plus fast charging - charge the WF-800N true wireless earphones for 10 minutes to enjoy 60 minutes of playback
Water and dust resistant (these Sony headphones come with an IP55* rating)
These Bluetooth headphones provide stable, reliable connectivity with a recent Bluetooth chip
With multi-size arc supporters for a secure fit, your wireless earbuds will remain in place
From the street to the gym, Sony Digital Noise Cancelling technology blocks out unwanted distractions, so it's just you and the beat

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
